why.headline: Why me
why.intro: I enjoy working in IT because clearly structured problems and well-thought-out solutions have always attracted me. Programming gives me the opportunity to implement ideas precisely while staying creative at the same time. What drives me is the desire to become a little better every day — not out of obligation, but out of genuine curiosity. New technologies, clean code patterns and well-executed projects by other developers inspire me to keep sharpening my own skills. It matters to me to work reliably, to truly understand things and to take responsibility for the outcome. I don’t just want to write code, but contribute to making projects stable, understandable and maintainable in the long run.
why.title: I am:

skills.headline: My Skill Set
skills.intro: I have worked on different projects where I used modern frontend technologies such as Angular, TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Through these diverse experiences, I learned to develop in a structured, clean and solution-oriented way. At the same time, I also took on backend tasks in several projects — including Python, Django, Flask, SQL and Firebase — which helps me understand applications as a whole. New technologies motivate me, and I adopt them quickly and openly in order to continuously expand my skills and adapt flexibly to new requirements.

mobile.intro: I love developing myself further and trying out new technologies directly in practice. If I can improve something, I do it — without detours. Innovation is not a buzzword for me, but the way I work: finding solutions that are smarter, faster and more stable. I keep myself technically up to date at all times, because standing still is not an option for me.
